maml:description.maml:para: Function used to clear content of select folder. By default it will only wipe items in the folder specified. When used with the flag 'Include Sub-folders' it will wipe both items and folders in selected folder.
User can specify mode that will be used to delete items/folders: - MoveToDeletedItems (default)

maml:Description.maml:para: Mode that should be used when removing items/folders. Will use MoveToDeletedItems mode when nothing is specified.
Service object that will be used to move folder.
Folder object that should be moved (retrieved using Get-EWSFolder).
Prompts you for confirmation before running the function.
Flag to specify if sub-folders and items in them should be removed too.
Shows what would happen if the function runs. The function is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the function.
Mode that should be used when removing items/folders. Will use MoveToDeletedItems mode when nothing is specified.
Folder object that should be moved (retrieved using Get-EWSFolder).
Flag to specify if sub-folders and items in them should be removed too.
Service object that will be used to move folder.
Shows what would happen if the function runs. The function is not run.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-EWSFolder Inbox\ToDelete | Clear-EWSFolder

dev:remarks.maml:para: Clears content of Inbox\ToDelete folder, leaving sub-folders intact. Will prompt the user before performing the operation. Uses MoveToDeletedItems mode to remove items (default).

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-EWSFolder Inbox\ToDelete | Clear-EWSFolder -IncludeSubfolders -Confirm:$false -DeleteMode HardDelete

dev:remarks.maml:para: Clears content of Inbox\ToDelete folder, including sub-folders and items found in them. Will not prompt the user before performing the operation. Uses HardDelete mode to remove items/folders.

maml:description.maml:para: Function that needs to be used first in order to create connection to Exchange Web Service. It supports both user-provided credentials and default credentials. By default it will attempt to auto-discover service URL. User may decide to provide it manually.

maml:Description.maml:para: Mailbox that supports Exchange Web Services.
Optional URL to service (when specified, auto-discovery is not used).
Version of Exchange Web Service.
Credentials used to authenticate to Exchange Web Service.
Credentials used to authenticate to Exchange Web Service.
Mailbox that supports Exchange Web Services.
Optional URL to service (when specified, auto-discovery is not used).
Version of Exchange Web Service.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Connect-EWSService -Mailbox bartek.bielawski@live.com

dev:remarks.maml:para: Connects to bartek.bielawski@live.com mailbox. Uses default credentials and auto-discovers service URL.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Connect-EWSService -Mailbox bartek.bielawski@live.com -Credential bartek.bielawski@live.com

dev:remarks.maml:para: Connects to bartek.bielawski@live.com mailbox. Prompts for bartek.bielawski@live.com password. Auto-discovers service URL.

maml:description.maml:para: Function that allows user to get attachment from item or items. Can be used in combination with Save-EWSAttachment.

maml:Description.maml:para: Item object that contains attachment (retrieved using Get-EWSItem).
Service object that will be used to get item/attachment.
Item object that contains attachment (retrieved using Get-EWSItem).
Service object that will be used to get item/attachment.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $item = Get-EWSItem -Name Inbox -Filter 'from:Sebastian and hasAttachment:true' -Limit 1 PS C:\> Get-EWSAttachment -Item $item

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets first e-mail sent from 'Sebastian' that has attachments. List any attachment find in this e-mail.

maml:description.maml:para: Function that is used to get folder in given path inside selected mailbox. The path needs to start with one of the well known folders (such as Inbox, or Calendar). Behavior is different depending on the completeness of the path: - complete path specified - target folder returned
- partial path specified - parent and all matching child folders will be returned.
If service/mailbox are not specified, default values are used: - for service - last service that user connected to in the current session
- for mailbox - matching mailbox from the last connected service.

maml:Description.maml:para: Path to folder inside the mailbox with two formats supported: WellKnownFolder\Full\Match - returns selected folder WellKnownFolder\Partial\MatchTo - returns parent folder and any folder matching to MatchTo.
Service used to communicate with selected mailbox.
Mailbox where folder is located.
Mailbox where folder is located.

Path to folder inside the mailbox with two formats supported: WellKnownFolder\Full\Match - returns selected folder WellKnownFolder\Partial\MatchTo - returns parent folder and any folder matching to MatchTo.
Service used to communicate with selected mailbox.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-EWSFolder -Path Inbox

dev:remarks.maml:para: Object representing Inbox in the last connected service is returned.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-EWSFolder -Path Inbox\A

dev:remarks.maml:para: Result depends on the presence of folder A. If folder 'A' doesn't exist, object representing Inbox in the last connected service is returned. If there is any folder underneath the Inbox with name that matches A, it's returned too. Finally if A exists, only that folder is returned.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-EWSFolder -Path Calendar -Service $myService

dev:remarks.maml:para: Object representing Calendar in the $myService service is returned.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets items inside selected mailbox and specified folder.

Functions used to get items from the selected folder inside mailbox. Filter is required and uses AQL syntax. You can read more about it here: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/office/dn579420(v=exchg.150).aspx.

Folders can be specified by Name (for well known folder names, like Inbox) or by Id (works for both well known and custom folders). For custom folders it's recommended to use Get-EWSFolder command first, and pipe results from it into Get-EWSItem.
By default not all properties are returned - behavior that can be changed by specifying PropertySet.

maml:Description.maml:para: Filter that will be used to get items needed. Uses AQL syntax (https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/office/dn579420(v=exchg.150).aspx)
Id of the folder that items will be retrieved from.
Number of items that should be returned in total.
Number of items tha should be returned per page of results.
Optional parameter used to change set of properties returned.
Service object that will be used to retrieve items.
Filter that will be used to get items needed. Uses AQL syntax (https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/office/dn579420(v=exchg.150).aspx)
Number of items that should be returned in total.
Name of the well known folder (e.g. Calendar, Inbox, Contacts)
Number of items tha should be returned per page of results.
Optional parameter used to change set of properties returned.
Service object that will be used to retrieve items.
Filter that will be used to get items needed. Uses AQL syntax (https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/office/dn579420(v=exchg.150).aspx)
Id of the folder that items will be retrieved from.
Number of items that should be returned in total.
Name of the well known folder (e.g. Calendar, Inbox, Contacts)
Number of items tha should be returned per page of results.
Optional parameter used to change set of properties returned.
Service object that will be used to retrieve items.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-EWSFolder Inbox\Urgent | Get-EWSItem -Filter subject:Call

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets all items in sub-folder 'Urgent' in Inbox of last connected service/mailbox. Items are filtered out and only items that have a word 'call' somewhere in the subject are returned.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-EWSItem -Name Inbox -Filter body:Azure -Limit 5

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets all items in Inbox of last connected service/mailbox. Items are filtered out and only items that have a word 'Azure' somewhere in the body are returned. Results are limited to first 5 results.

maml:description.maml:para: Moves folder to a different location.
Function used to move folder from current location to the new location. Destination folder has to exist for move to succeed.

maml:Description.maml:para: Path to the folder where the folder should be moved.
Folder object that should be moved (retrieved using Get-EWSFolder).
Service object that will be used to move folder.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the function.
Shows what would happen if the function runs. The function is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the function.
Path to the folder where the folder should be moved.
Folder object that should be moved (retrieved using Get-EWSFolder).
Service object that will be used to move folder.
Shows what would happen if the function runs. The function is not run.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-EWSFolder -Path Inbox\Test | Move-EWSFolder -DestinationPath Inbox\Parent

dev:remarks.maml:para: Folder 'Test' located inside Inbox is moved as a sub-folder to Inbox\Parent.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $folder = Get-EWSFolder -Path Inbox\Parent\Test PS C:\> Move-EWSFolder -DestinationPath Inbox -Folder $folder

dev:remarks.maml:para: Folder 'Test' located inside Inbox\Parent is moved as a sub-folder to Inbox.

maml:description.maml:para: Moves item to a different location.
Function used to move item from current location to the new location. Destination folder has to exist for move to succeed.

maml:Description.maml:para: Path to the folder where the item should be moved.
Item object that should be moved (retrieved using Get-EWSItem).
Service object that will be used to move item.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the function.
Shows what would happen if the function runs. The function is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the function.
Path to the folder where the item should be moved.
Item object that should be moved (retrieved using Get-EWSItem).
Service object that will be used to move item.
Shows what would happen if the function runs. The function is not run.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-EWSItem -Name Inbox -Filter subject:test -Limit 1 | Move-EWSItem -DestinationPath Inbox\Moved

dev:remarks.maml:para: First item found in Inbox with subject that contains word 'test' is moved to Inbox\Moved.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $item = Get-EWSFolder -Path Inbox\Moved | Get-EWSItem -Filter subject:test -Limit 1 PS C:\> Move-EWSItem -DestinationPath Inbox -Folder $item

dev:remarks.maml:para: First item found in Inbox\Moved with subject that contains word 'test' is moved to Inbox.

maml:description.maml:para: Function that can be used to create appointments. I requires following fields: - Subject
Optional parameters that can be used: - Required (required attendees)
You can pipe in the body of appointment. If the body is in HTML format, use -IsHtml flag.

maml:Description.maml:para: Paths to attachments that should be added to the new appointment.
Body of the appointment.
Type of body of the appointment. Text is used if not specified.
Duration of the appointment.
Location of the appointment.
List of optional attendees.
List of required attendees.
Service used to create new appointment.
Date/time of the appointment start.
Subject of the appointment.
Paths to attachments that should be added to the new appointment.
Type of body of the appointment. Text is used if not specified.
Duration of the appointment.
Content piped into the function. It's used to form appointment's body.
Flag to specify that piped-in content is already formatted as HTML.
Location of the appointment.
List of optional attendees.
List of required attendees.
Service used to create new appointment.
Date/time of the appointment start.
Subject of the appointment.
Paths to attachments that should be added to the new appointment.
Body of the appointment.
Type of body of the appointment. Text is used if not specified.
Duration of the appointment.
Content piped into the function. It's used to form appointment's body.
Flag to specify that piped-in content is already formatted as HTML.
Location of the appointment.
List of optional attendees.
List of required attendees.
Service used to create new appointment.
Date/time of the appointment start.
Subject of the appointment.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-EWSAppointment -Subject Dentist -Body 'Visit Dentist' -Start (Get-Date).AddDays(1) -Duration 0:30:0

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates appointment in the calendar about Dentist visit planned for tomorrow that will take half of an hour.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates new contacts using provided contact details.

Function that helps creating new contacts. It accepts single hash table for phone and physical address with details of the contact. Keys of these hash tables need to match with the types defined for a given contact, e.g.: Phone: HomePhone, MobilePhone PhysicalAddress: Home, Business
Emails, on the other hand, accepts array of hash tables, each with two keys: DisplayName and email.

maml:Description.maml:para: First name of the contact.
Last name of the contact.
Middle name of the contact.
Name of the contact's company.
Hash table with phone details of the contact, each key has to match to phone type.
Collection of hash tables with two keys: Email and DisplayName.
Hash table with physical address details of the contact, each key has to match to physical address type. Each value is another hash table with keys matching to properties of the address.
Service used to create new contact.
Name of the contact's company.
Collection of hash tables with two keys: Email and DisplayName.
First name of the contact.
Middle name of the contact.
Hash table with phone details of the contact, each key has to match to phone type.
Hash table with physical address details of the contact, each key has to match to physical address type. Each value is another hash table with keys matching to properties of the address.
Service used to create new contact.
Last name of the contact.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-EWSContact -GivenName John -Surname Doe

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create new contact for 'John Doe' without any details populated.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create new contact for 'John Doe' with e-mail and two phone types specified.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates sub-folder in the specified parent folder.
Function used to create folders in the folder structure of a mailbox. Parent folder can be specified by name (for well known folder names) or Id.

maml:Description.maml:para: Display name of the created folder.
Type of the folder to create. Supported types: - Mail (default)
- Calendar
- Contacts
- Tasks
Mailbox where folder will be created.
Id of the Parent folder (useful for nested folders).
Service object that will be used to create a folder.
Display name of the created folder.
Type of the folder to create. Supported types: - Mail (default)
- Calendar
- Contacts
- Tasks
Mailbox where folder will be created.
Well known name of the parent folder (e.g. Inbox, Calendar).
Service object that will be used to create a folder.
Display name of the created folder.
Type of the folder to create. Supported types: - Mail (default)
- Calendar
- Contacts
- Tasks
Mailbox where folder will be created.
Id of the Parent folder (useful for nested folders).
Well known name of the parent folder (e.g. Inbox, Calendar).
Service object that will be used to create a folder.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-EWSFolder -ParentName Inbox -DisplayName FooBar

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create sub-folder FooBar in the folder Inbox.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-EWSFolder -Path Contacts\Parent | New-EWSFolder -DisplayName Child -FolderType Contacts

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create sub-folder Child designed to store Contacts inside Contacts\Parent.

maml:description.maml:para: Function that can be used to create e-mails. Required parameters: - To
Latter can be piped in the function.
E-mail is sent and saved to 'Sent Items' folder.

maml:Description.maml:para: Paths to attachments that should be added to the message.
Background carbon copy - hidden recipients of the e-mail.
Body of the e-mail.
Type of the e-mail body. The default is Text.
Carbon copy - indirect recipients of the e-mail.
Service used to create/send message.
Subject of the created message.
Main recipients of the message.
Paths to attachments that should be added to the message.
Background carbon copy - hidden recipients of the e-mail.
Type of the e-mail body. The default is Text.
Carbon copy - indirect recipients of the e-mail.
Input text that will be used as a message body.
Flag to specify that command input is already converted to HTML.
Service used to create/send message.
Subject of the created message.
Main recipients of the message.
Paths to attachments that should be added to the message.
Background carbon copy - hidden recipients of the e-mail.
Body of the e-mail.
Type of the e-mail body. The default is Text.
Carbon copy - indirect recipients of the e-mail.
Input text that will be used as a message body.
Flag to specify that command input is already converted to HTML.
Service used to create/send message.
Subject of the created message.
Main recipients of the message.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-EWSMessage -To MrBeans@gmail.com -Subject Test -Body 'Mic test: 1... 2... 3...'

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sends e-mail to MrBeans@gmail.com using last connected service with subject Test and specified body.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $html = Get-ChildItem | Select-Object -Property Name, Length, LastWriteTime | ConvertTo-Html PS C:\> $html | New-EWSMessage -To MrBeans@gmail.com -Subject Test -Body 'Mic test: 1... 2... 3...' -IsHtml -BodyType HTML

dev:remarks.maml:para: Generates HTML document from the output of Get-ChildITem Sends e-mail to MrBeans@gmail.com using last connected service with subject Test and $html as HTML body.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes folder in a specified delete mode.
Function used to remove folder in one of three ways: - HardDelete
All items in the folder are deleted too.

maml:Description.maml:para: Mode used to delete folder. If not specified, MoveToDeletedItems mode is used.
Service object that will be used to remove folder.
Folder object that should be removed (retrieved using Get-EWSFolder).
Prompts you for confirmation before running the function.
Shows what would happen if the function runs. The function is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the function.
Mode used to delete folder. If not specified, MoveToDeletedItems mode is used.
Folder object that should be removed (retrieved using Get-EWSFolder).
Service object that will be used to remove folder.
Shows what would happen if the function runs. The function is not run.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-EWSFolder -Path Inbox\ToDelete | Remove-EWSFolder

dev:remarks.maml:para: Prompts user to confirm deletion of Inbox\ToDelete folder. Once confirmed delete folder using MoveToDeletedItems (default) DeleteMode.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $folder = Get-EWSFolder -Path Inbox\ToDelete PS C:\> Remove-EWSFolder -Folder $folder -DeleteMode HardDelete -Confirm:$false

dev:remarks.maml:para: Deletes Inbox\ToDelete folder using HardDelete mode.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes item in a specified delete mode.
Function used to remove item in one of three ways: - HardDelete

maml:Description.maml:para: Mode used to delete item. If not specified, MoveToDeletedItems mode is used.
Service object that will be used to remove item.
Item object that should be removed (retrieved using Get-EWSItem).
Prompts you for confirmation before running the function.
Shows what would happen if the function runs. The function is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the function.
Mode used to delete item. If not specified, MoveToDeletedItems mode is used.
Item object that should be removed (retrieved using Get-EWSItem).
Service object that will be used to remove item.
Shows what would happen if the function runs. The function is not run.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-EWSFolder -Path Inbox\ToDelete | Get-EWSItem -Filter IsRead:true | Remove-EWSItem

dev:remarks.maml:para: Prompts user to confirm deletion of read (IsRead:true) items in Inbox\ToDelete folder. Once confirmed delete items using MoveToDeletedItems (default) DeleteMode.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $item = Get-EWSFolder -Path Inbox\ToDelete | Get-EWSItem -Filter IsRead:true -Limit 1 PS C:\> Remove-EWSItem -Folder $item -DeleteMode HardDelete -Confirm:$false

dev:remarks.maml:para: Deletes first read (IsRead:true) item from Inbox\ToDelete folder using HardDelete mode.

maml:description.maml:para: Function used to save attachments found in items to disk. Need to be used in combination with Get-EWSAttachment.

maml:Description.maml:para: Folder where attachments should be saved.
Attachment object that should be saved to disk (retrieved using Get-EWSAttachment).
Service object that will be used to get/save attachment.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the function.
Shows what would happen if the function runs. The function is not run.
Attachment object that should be saved to disk (retrieved using Get-EWSAttachment).
Prompts you for confirmation before running the function.
Folder where attachments should be saved.
Service object that will be used to get/save attachment.
Shows what would happen if the function runs. The function is not run.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $item = Get-EWSItem -Name Inbox -Filter 'from:Sebastian and hasAttachment:true' -Limit 1 PS C:\> Get-EWSAttachment -Item $item | Save-EWSAttachment -Path c:\temp\

dev:remarks.maml:para: Saves attachment from e-mail to c:\temp\ folder.
